overview:
Reggie Aggarwal is a noted leader in Washington’s high-tech and association communities. He is the CEO and Founder of Cvent, a profitable venture-backed CRM software company with 800+ employees. Cvent has quickly grown to be the largest event management software company in the country, organizing over 275,000 events for over 7,500+ customers in 40 countries such as KPMG, Hilton and Siemens.

Reggie was named Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the YearÂ® 2009 in the Greater Washington area. Washingtonian Magazine named him to its 2011 list of the 100 Tech Titans of Washington. Forbes Magazine called him one of the rising stars of Washington. Washington Business Forward magazine named him to its list of the Washington, D.C.’s 40 most influential business leaders, along with the CEOs of Nasdaq, AOL, and Marriott. MeetingNews, the largest magazine in the industry, named him as one of the 25 most influential people in the $100 billion dollar meetings industry. He was also appointed by the Governor of Virginia to be Chairman of the Chief Information Officers Advisory Commission. In addition, Cvent has been selected by the Washington Business Journal as one of the 50 Best Places to Work in Greater Washington from 2009 to 2011.

Reggie is the Founder and Chairman Emeritus of the Indian CEO High Tech Council (now the DC Chapter of TiE), described by the Washington Post as “maybe the singularly most successful association in the past decade.” The group has grown from 75 to over 4,500 CEO’s and Senior Executives in under 4 years.

He has been featured in over 100 articles including Business Week, USA Today, Forbes, and the Washington Post. He has appeared on ABC News, CBS News, NBC News and CNN’s “Moneyline with Lou Dobbs” as an authority on meetings and technology. In addition, Reggie served on the Board of Directors of the Greater Washington Board of Trade, Inova Healthcare System, and the DC Chamber of Commerce. He was also on the Global Board of Trustees of TiE as well as Sales and Marketing Executive International.

degrees.institution: Washington and Lee University Law School

milestones.description: won the 2009 ernst & young entrepreneur of the year for Washington, DC
